chargeHist.descr: Homicide by Intoxicated Use of Vehicle
Homicide by Intoxicated Use of Vehicle

result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Connor Charles Johnson was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Seek and maintain full time employment or education, or a combination of both.
No entry into taverns or bars except as permitted by Agent. 
Speak 2 times per year at a program arranged by SCVRJ. 
Comply with any other counseling through probation. 
No consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs allowed. May only have the prescribed amount of prescription drugs.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Connor Charles Johnson
Current: W10830 522nd Ave, Prescott, WI 54021 United States  (Effective: 08-27-2020)
Prior: W6314 690th Avenue, Beldenville, WI 54003 United States
from the DOC requesting clarification of the probationary term.

Defendant pleads guilty to the charge.   Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty  Victim rights have been complied with.  Court orders 4 years probation concurrent to probation on Ct 2  14CF203.  Clerk to add on the JOC - Probation length of 4 years is ordered because of 973.09(2)(b)(2).  Conditions of probation": 6 months jail stayed until 5-27-2015 at 7:00 PM  Huber is allowed.  Other conditions as set forth in the Additional Conditions of the Deferred Acceptance of Guilty or No Contest Plea Ageement filed in 14CF203 Maintain full-time employment or education or a comibination of both which may not be individually full-time.   Defendant is not allowed to possess or consume alcohol and is not allowed in any bars or taverns without the probation agents consent.  Defendant will speak 2 times per year at events arranged throught St Croix Valey Restorative Justice Program.   Pay restitution in the amount of $14,642.69 for Funeral Expenses incurred by the Rhiel Family. Court Costs and DNA are waived. . Expungment will be granted if the defendant successfully completes the deferred prosecution agreement and probation. Appeal rights have been given to the defendant. They will be sent to the court within the week.
Deferred Acceptance of Guilty or No Contest Plea Agreement

1:11 This included 15CF113.  Defendant Connor Charles Johnson in court with attorney Harry R Hertel.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Plead to Ct 1  Reckless driving in 15CF113.  Ct 2  OWI 2ND. Ct 3  Hit and Run causing injury. ( Will have a DPA for 5 years)    Ct  4  PAC   Ct 1-case 15CF113  Probation   Ct 2  Probation ( total of 4 years for 2 counts)  6 Mo Jail. on Ct 1 case 15CF113  Ct 2  15 days jail conscet to Ct 1 15CF113  Fine 1442.00 12 Mo revocation  AODA  Cond: Maintain full time employment or education of a cominbation of both for 5 years.  POss   Speak at least 2 times per year at forums on the actions this had on his life through SCVRJ program.  Any time longer than 2 times it would go toward community service. Restitution - Pay  $14,642.69  funeral expenses which would be paid through probation as a condition.   No consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs allowed. May only have the prescribed amount of prescription drugs.NOt allowed in bars or taverns. The parties are requesting expungement - Court explains that cannot be done with all the counts in one case. It would require an amended complaint ( information)  in the original file and a new case filing for the count that cannot be expunged. Victim rights have been complied with. Court reviews the counts with the defendant.  Ct 1- 15CF113  Ct 2 OWI 2nd  Guilty to both counts - Probation.  Plead to Ct 3 and DPA would be approved by the court. Court explains the procedure for DPA.  Ct 4 PAC to be dismissed. Defendant pleads guilty to Ct 1  in 15CF113.  Ct 2 Defendant pleads Guilty, Ct 3 Defendant pleads guilty.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def    Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights   Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS    The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of Ct 2,3, of 14CF203. Dismisses Ct#1 and Ct#4 in 14CF203  Court finds defendant guilty of Ct 1 as represented in 15CF133,  Ct 2 , and Ct 3 of 14CF203 . Conditions of the DPA are reviewed with the defendant. Court will approve the DPA. Court reviewed the letters from Bob and Teresa Rhiel and the 51 other letters that we sent to the court as character references. Defendant's father reads a letter to the court. Each attorney addresses the court. Defendant addresses the court. Court  orders: 15CF113 Ct 1 & Ct2 14CF203  S/W Probation 4 yrs. on each ct conc. Cond:   6 mo jail with huber on Ct 1 15CF113 and 15 days on Ct 2 14CF203 conc. ON Ct 1 15CF113 Court costs without DNA surcharge DNA Surcharge.    Ct 2 14CF203  Fine   $1442.002 Ct 2 14CF203 .  DNA sample   12 month revocation.  AODA driver safety  plan  IID for 1 year.  IID surcharge on Ct 2     Seek and maintain full time, employment   No Alcohol allowed. No bars or taverns except as permitted by probation agent. . Speak 2 times per year at programs by arranged by  SCVRJ $ 14642.69 restitution to Robert and Teresa Rhiel.  Comply with any other counseling through probation.  Court approves the DPA  2 days sentence credit and the 1st 48 hours without huber.  Jail stayed until May 27   7:00 PM    Expungement is approved by the court if probation and the DPA are  successfully completed.   The amended informtion and the new case will be filed by tomorrow night. 
Motion for return of property is made by Hertel. Atty Seifter to contact the PCSD to see if there is anything that they need to retain. Will inform the court of what Atty Seifert found out at the telephone hearing which will be held tomorrow at 1:30.
Additional Conditions of the Deferred Acceptance of Guilty or No Contest Plea Agreement
changing status to plea and sentencing

3:01  Defendant Connor Charles Johnson in court with attorney Harry R Hertel.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Hertel addresses and wants case to be adjourned 30 days out. Court inquires into victim rights complied with and  restitution . Set for status conf. Bond coditions will continue  Status conference scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Information Filed with the Court and a copy is given to the defendant.  Hertel and def discuss the Information.  The charges are identical to the criminal complaint.  Def waives reading.    DEF PLEADS NOT GUILTY TO ALL 4 COUNTS.  Court reads the charges and maximum penalties.    Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.
NOT GUILTY PLEA IS ENTERED ON ALL COUNTS.  Def will meet with the victim's family to discuss resolution.   Hertel is asking for a status conference.

1:07 pm  
Defendant Connor Charles Johnson in court with attorney Harry R Hertel.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hertel and def will waive the preliminary hearing.  Court explains the preliminary hearing process.  Def understands the waiver.  Def states he waives his preliminary hearing knowingly and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver of preliminary hearing and binds defendant over for further proceedings.  Status conference scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on February 24, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Def voluntarily waives the 20 day time limit for preliminary hearing.   Def may also waive the preliminary hearing, but reserves that right.
